prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Alice Maude Ewell Collection, Accession #01437, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection purchased from Jerry N. Showalter, Ivy, VA, on August 21, 1997.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The collection contains manuscripts of a World War I poem "The March"; two short stories, "The Old, Old Mistress" and "A Wartime Episode"; an essay on Reconstruction and the servant problem told from the viewpoint of the descendant of Virginia gentry, titled "A Price and a Problem"; and the last page of an unidentified short story.
There is also a pencil sketch by Ewell of an area of the Bull Runn battlefield near the Henry House, drawn for her book "A Virginia Scene."

did.unittitle: Pencil sketch by Alice Maude Ewell, "Where the Battle was Fought" ca. 1931

scopecontent.p: Sketch refers to the Battle of Bull Run and was used in A Virginia Scene
